did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Drafts, interview transcripts and other materials relating to a book project on family farming. Correspondence, materials relating to Rural Sociology courses he taught on Farm Families. Other materials relating to his time as the Cornell University Archivist.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Drafts, interview transcripts and other materials relating to a book project on family farming. Correspondence, materials relating to Rural Sociology courses he taught on Farm Families. Other materials relating to his time as the Cornell University Archivist.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Farm family interview materials and Residential Club fire folder are restricted to permission of the University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Gould P. Colman Papers, #13-6-1958. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

emph.ref: Series III. Lectures, papers, and conference presentations

arrangement.p: Interview transcripts have been foldered, but left in original order.

processinfo.p: Folder titles reflect names as listed in interview; names have been changed for "Family Business" book, and some names as listed on interviews are hybrids.

processinfo.p: Folder titles reflect working titles listed on drafts; final book and chapter titles as published in "Family Business" may differ.

did.unittitle: Comments on Puryear cases of DeGolyer
"Making Decisions in Farm Families: A Framework for Analysis"
Preface "A Different Way of Doing Business" draft
"Farming: Another Way of Doing Business" draft
"Farming: Another Way of Doing Business" final draft
"Our Farm Needs Everybody" draft with comments
"Chapter II: The Farm Needs Everyone" draft
"Chapter II: The Farm Needs Everyone" draft
"Chapter II: The Farm Needs Everyone" draft
"Farming: A Different Way of Doing Business" unpublished draft
"The Brothers" draft with Chris Engst comments

arrangement.p: Interview transcripts have been foldered, but left in original order.

processinfo.p: Some by Gould Colman, others by colleagues. Authors marked where known.

did.unittitle: Rural Studies Group Fall Seminar Series syllabus
American Farm Women Conference seminar participants list
"The Farmer Takes a Wife: Women in America's Farming Families" by Sarah Elbert
"Amber Waves of Gain: Women's Work in New York Families" by Sarah Elbert
"Contented Cows and Dairy Maids: Patriarchy and Capitalism in American Agriculture" by Sarah Elbert
"Farming Families: The Farm Needs Everyone" by Gould Colman and Sarah Elbert

scopecontent.p: No author listed, but possibly by Allen Bjergo and Tom Ruffatto.
No author listed, but possibly by Allen Bjergo and Tom Ruffatto.

did.unittitle: "Contented Cows and Dairy Maids: Patriarchy and Capitalism in American Agriculture" by Sarah Elbert
"American Farm Women in Historical Perspective" conference materials
"Summary of Major Findings from American Farm Women: Findings from a National Survey" by Calvin Jones and Rachel Rosenfeld
"The Historical Roots of Occupational Sexism" by Heidi Hartmann
"Inventory of the family's human resources and procedures for use"
"Art, Occupation, and Mystery: Making Decisions in U.S. Farming" article drafts and correspondence
"Art, Occupation, and Mystery: Making Decisions in U.S. Farming"
"The Division of Labor in Families and the Development of Adolescent Farm Girls in the 1970s" by Janet Kalinowski
Papers for Rural Sociological Society conference, Farm Family session
"Psychological Stress Among Farm Women" by Alan Berkowitz
"Farm Husbands and Wives in Wisconsin" by Eugene A. Wilkening
Conference concerning research on farm women
"Farm Women in Historical Perspective" conference materials
Extension in-service training schedule and notes
"Farm Families: What Are Good Decisions" lecture notes
"The History pf Agricultural Education at Cornell University" correspondence and notes
Farming lecture: notes and course reading lists
Rural Sociology 417: Farm Families: How They Make Decisions and Set Goals course materials

accessrestrict.p: Restricted to permission of the University Archivist.

did.unittitle: Copy of NAFTA letter signed by five presidents

scopecontent.p: Includes letter from Robert Pastor at the Carter Center explaining how the NAFTA letter was created and signed.

did.unittitle: Envelope from Cooperative Extension Service, Montana State University

scopecontent.p: Contains photos, newspaper clippings, and "Addition to 'Ranching.'"

processinfo.p: Date listed is from postmark on envelope.

did.unittitle: "Jewish comes up in you from the roots" by Bobbe-Myseh
"A Philosopher Among Economists" by John Brewster photocopy
Bill Fogle Residential Club fire files

accessrestrict.p: Restricted to permission of the University Archivist.

scopecontent.p: Photographs from the Alumni Affairs/Archives Photo Exhibit, used in Barton Hall during Reunion Week in 1987. They were available to Cornell class of 1987 alumni for purchase.
Photographs from the Alumni Affairs/Archives Photo Exhibit, used in Barton Hall during Reunion Week in 1987. They were available to Cornell class of 1987 alumni for purchase.
